EHR_01.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Headache

History of Present Illness: Patient reports symptoms for several days. No severe complications noted.

Examination Findings: Normal temperature, stable vitals, mild abnormal findings depending on symptom.

Diagnosis: Asthma Exacerbation

Plan: Rest, fluids, medication as required, follow up in 3 days if symptoms persist.

EHR_02.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Fever

History of Present Illness: High fever (103°F) for 2 days, difficulty swallowing, denies cough.

Examination Findings: Elevated temperature, stable vitals, tonsillar exudates present.

Diagnosis: Strep Throat

Plan: Amoxicillin 500mg twice daily for 10 days, fluids, rest.

EHR_03.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Knee Pain

History of Present Illness: Chronic pain, worse in the morning, gradually worsening over 5 years.

Examination Findings: Mild swelling noted in the right knee, limited range of motion, no warmth.

Diagnosis: Osteoarthritis, right knee

Plan: Physical therapy referral, over-the-counter NSAIDs for pain, follow-up in 4 weeks.

EHR_04.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Shortness of Breath

History of Present Illness: Sudden onset of difficulty breathing, associated with productive cough and chest pain.

Examination Findings: Low oxygen saturation (92%), decreased breath sounds in lower left lobe, mild fever.

Diagnosis: Community-acquired Pneumonia

Plan: Azithromycin, respiratory support, admitted to hospital for observation and IV fluids.

EHR_05.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Back Pain

History of Present Illness: Lifted a heavy box yesterday, sudden sharp pain in lower back, radiates slightly into buttocks.

Examination Findings: No motor deficits, positive straight leg raise, tenderness in lumbar paraspinal muscles.

Diagnosis: Acute Lumbar Strain

Plan: Rest, heat/ice application, muscle relaxants for 5 days, return to work restrictions.

EHR_06.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Rash

History of Present Illness: New, intensely itchy rash appeared on forearms and neck after using a new laundry detergent.

Examination Findings: Erythematous, vesicular rash consistent with external irritant exposure.

Diagnosis: Contact Dermatitis, generalized

Plan: Avoid irritant, prescribe topical corticosteroid, hydroxyzine for itching.

EHR_07.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Abdominal Pain

History of Present Illness: Severe cramping, nausea, vomiting started 12 hours ago, two episodes of diarrhea.

Examination Findings: Mild diffuse tenderness upon palpation, guarding absent, hydration status slightly decreased.

Diagnosis: Acute Gastroenteritis

Plan: Clear liquid diet, anti-emetic medication PRN, strict monitoring for dehydration, return if symptoms worsen.

EHR_08.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Chronic Fatigue

History of Present Illness: Persistent tiredness for the last 6 months, difficulty concentrating, feeling cold often.

Examination Findings: Vitals stable, pallor noted, otherwise unremarkable physical exam.

Diagnosis: Iron Deficiency Anemia

Plan: Order CBC and Ferritin levels, begin oral Iron supplementation (Ferrous Sulfate).

EHR_09.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Eye Redness

History of Present Illness: Redness, discharge, and feeling of grit in both eyes started 3 days ago. Highly contagious.

Examination Findings: Bilateral conjunctival injection, purulent discharge, preauricular lymphadenopathy.

Diagnosis: Bacterial Conjunctivitis

Plan: Antibiotic eye drops (Tobramycin) for 7 days, strict hygiene, avoid school/daycare until discharge resolves.

EHR_10.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Frequent Urination

History of Present Illness: Increased frequency and urgency, especially at night, mild difficulty starting stream.

Examination Findings: Digital Rectal Exam (DRE) reveals an enlarged, smooth prostate.

Diagnosis: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH)

Plan: Order PSA and urinalysis, start Tamsulosin, follow up with Urology if no improvement in 6 weeks.

EHR_11.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Sore Throat

History of Present Illness: Gradual onset of throat discomfort, mild cough, no fever.

Examination Findings: Mild pharyngeal erythema, negative rapid Strep test.

Diagnosis: Acute Pharyngitis (viral)

Plan: Symptomatic treatment: lozenges, fluids, warm salt water gargles.

EHR_12.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Ear Pain

History of Present Illness: Pain in the left ear for 24 hours, associated with muffled hearing.

Examination Findings: Left tympanic membrane is erythematous and bulging, decreased mobility.

Diagnosis: Acute Otitis Media, left ear

Plan: Amoxicillin for 7 days, NSAIDs for pain, recheck in 10 days.

EHR_13.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Heartburn

History of Present Illness: Burning sensation in chest, worse after eating and when lying down, nocturnal symptoms present.

Examination Findings: Abdominal exam benign, no epigastric tenderness.

Diagnosis: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)

Plan: Lifestyle modification (elevate head of bed, dietary changes), prescribe PPI (Omeprazole).

EHR_14.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Depression

History of Present Illness: Low mood, anhedonia, difficulty sleeping and concentrating for 4 months. Denies suicidal ideation.

Examination Findings: Appearance appropriate, affect constricted, oriented x3.

Diagnosis: Major Depressive Disorder, single episode, unspecified

Plan: Start SSRI (Sertraline), referral to talk therapy, follow up in 2 weeks for medication check.

EHR_15.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Ankle Sprain

History of Present Illness: Twisted ankle while playing basketball 3 hours ago, immediate pain and swelling.

Examination Findings: Moderate swelling and ecchymosis over lateral ankle, tender over ATF ligament, negative squeeze test.

Diagnosis: Lateral Ankle Sprain (Grade II)

Plan: R.I.C.E. protocol (Rest, Ice, Compression, Elevation), crutches for ambulation, orthopedic referral if no improvement.

EHR_16.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Elevated Blood Pressure

History of Present Illness: Routine BP check showed 155/95mmHg, asymptomatic, non-compliant with diet.

Examination Findings: BP 150/92mmHg today, cardiovascular exam normal.

Diagnosis: Essential Primary Hypertension, uncontrolled

Plan: Initiate ACE inhibitor (Lisinopril), strict diet and exercise counseling, monitor BP at home daily.

EHR_17.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Acne Flare

History of Present Illness: Increased number of cystic lesions on face and back over the past month.

Examination Findings: Multiple comedones, papules, and cystic lesions on T-zone and upper back.

Diagnosis: Acne Vulgaris, moderate

Plan: Prescribe topical retinoid (Tretinoin), benzoyl peroxide wash, follow up in 6 weeks.

EHR_18.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Tinea Pedis (Athlete's Foot)

History of Present Illness: Persistent itching and peeling between toes, mild odor, started after using a public gym shower.

Examination Findings: Maceration and scaling noted between 4th and 5th toes bilaterally.

Diagnosis: Tinea Pedis

Plan: Apply topical antifungal cream (Clotrimazole) twice daily, keep feet dry, wear sandals in public showers.

EHR_19.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Vertigo

History of Present Illness: Sudden onset of spinning dizziness when turning head quickly, lasts about 30 seconds.

Examination Findings: Positive Dix-Hallpike maneuver (nystagmus noted).

Diagnosis: Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo (BPPV)

Plan: Perform Epley maneuver in office, provide home instructions for Epley, return if symptoms persist.

EHR_20.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Diaper Rash

History of Present Illness: Severe redness and irritation in diaper area for 3 days, refractory to routine cream.

Examination Findings: Confluent erythema in the gluteal fold with satellite lesions suggestive of Candida.

Diagnosis: Candidal Diaper Dermatitis

Plan: Apply Nystatin topical powder, frequent diaper changes, use barrier cream (Zinc Oxide).

EHR_21.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Chest Pain

History of Present Illness: Intermittent, dull ache in the chest, non-exertional, denies diaphoresis or shortness of breath.

Examination Findings: EKG normal, vitals stable, pulmonary exam clear.

Diagnosis: Non-cardiac Chest Pain (Rule out Musculoskeletal)

Plan: Order Chest X-ray, consider trial of anti-inflammatory medication, return immediately if pain changes or worsens.

EHR_22.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Migraine

History of Present Illness: Severe, pulsating headache with aura (flashing lights), nausea, sensitive to light and sound.

Examination Findings: Normal neurological exam, vitals stable.

Diagnosis: Migraine with aura, intractable

Plan: Prescribe sumatriptan for abortive therapy, discuss prophylactic medication options (Beta Blocker).

EHR_23.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Cough

History of Present Illness: Dry, hacking cough for 1 week, worse at night, history of mild asthma.

Examination Findings: Mild wheezing heard on forced expiration, otherwise clear lung fields.

Diagnosis: Acute Bronchitis

Plan: Symptomatic care (dextromethorphan PRN), monitor for signs of secondary bacterial infection.

EHR_24.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Hypertension Follow-up

History of Present Illness: Has been taking Amlodipine for 3 months, reports excellent compliance.

Examination Findings: BP 135/85mmHg, vitals stable.

Diagnosis: Essential Primary Hypertension, well controlled

Plan: Continue current medication dosage, lifestyle maintenance, recheck BP in 6 months.

EHR_25.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)

History of Present Illness: Dysuria, frequency, urgency, no fever or flank pain.

Examination Findings: Mild suprapubic tenderness, clean-catch urine sample obtained.

Diagnosis: Acute Cystitis (uncomplicated UTI)

Plan: Prescribe Nitrofurantoin for 5 days, encourage fluid intake, send urine culture for confirmation.

EHR_26.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Pilonidal Cyst

History of Present Illness: Painful lump noticed in the gluteal cleft for 4 days, recently became red and swollen.

Examination Findings: Tender, fluctuant mass in the sacrococcygeal area, signs of localized infection.

Diagnosis: Pilonidal Cyst with abscess

Plan: Incision and drainage (I&D) performed in office, pack wound, Keflex for 7 days, follow up for wound check.

EHR_27.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Hypothyroidism Follow-up

History of Present Illness: Taking Levothyroxine 50ug, reports fatigue is improved but still present.

Examination Findings: Vitals stable, neck exam negative for masses, TSH ordered.

Diagnosis: Acquired Hypothyroidism, suboptimally controlled

Plan: Adjust Levothyroxine dosage to 75ug daily, recheck TSH in 6 weeks, counsel on adherence.

EHR_28.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Acne

History of Present Illness: Persistent blackheads and whiteheads on the forehead and nose, not responding to drugstore washes.

Examination Findings: Open and closed comedones noted on the forehead and bridge of the nose.

Diagnosis: Acne Vulgaris, comedonal

Plan: Begin topical Salicylic Acid wash, start Tretinoin nightly, emphasize not picking lesions.

EHR_29.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Annual Physical

History of Present Illness: Screening lab work completed, reports no new complaints, compliant with medications.

Examination Findings: Full exam normal, BP 120/78mmHg, BMI 24.5.

Diagnosis: Encounter for routine examination

Plan: Continue current healthy habits, schedule mammogram and colonoscopy screening per guidelines.

EHR_30.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Allergic Rhinitis

History of Present Illness: Persistent nasal congestion, sneezing, and watery eyes, worse during spring season.

Examination Findings: Nasal turbinates are pale and boggy, clear rhinorrhea present.

Diagnosis: Allergic Rhinitis due to pollen

Plan: Start non-sedating antihistamine (Cetirizine) daily, use Fluticasone nasal spray, avoid outdoor exposure on high pollen days.

EHR_31.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Insomnia

History of Present Illness: Difficulty falling asleep and maintaining sleep, waking up several times per night.

Examination Findings: Normal neurological exam, denies depression or anxiety symptoms as primary complaint.

Diagnosis: Insomnia, unspecified

Plan: Sleep hygiene counseling (consistent routine, limit screens), prescribe low-dose Trazodone PRN.

EHR_32.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Laceration

History of Present Illness: Fell off bicycle and sustained a cut to the right arm 30 minutes ago.

Examination Findings: 2cm clean, non-jagged laceration over the right forearm, bleeding controlled.

Diagnosis: Laceration without foreign body, right forearm

Plan: Clean wound, apply 5 sutures, apply dressing, tetanus status confirmed up-to-date, follow up in 10 days for suture removal.

EHR_33.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Premenstrual Syndrome (PMS)

History of Present Illness: Monthly cycles of irritability, bloating, and breast tenderness starting 7-10 days before menses.

Examination Findings: Pelvic exam deferred, breast exam negative for masses.

Diagnosis: Premenstrual Tension Syndrome

Plan: Recommend regular aerobic exercise, dietary changes (less salt/caffeine), consider oral contraceptives for symptom management.

EHR_34.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Tinnitus

History of Present Illness: Persistent ringing sound in the ears, worse in quiet environments, denies hearing loss.

Examination Findings: Audiometry pending, Otoscopy normal.

Diagnosis: Tinnitus, unilateral, left ear

Plan: Avoid loud noises, reduce caffeine intake, ENT referral for specialized evaluation.

EHR_35.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Foreign Body in Skin

History of Present Illness: Stepped on a small piece of glass or splinter in the foot two days ago, slight discomfort remains.

Examination Findings: Small, dark, pinpoint object visible under the skin surface of the plantar foot.

Diagnosis: Foreign body (splinter) in the skin, right foot

Plan: Local anesthesia, sterile removal of foreign body with tweezers, application of antibiotic ointment and bandage.

EHR_36.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Weight Management

History of Present Illness: Seeking advice for 20kg weight loss, motivated to make lifestyle changes.

Examination Findings: BMI 32 (Obese Class I), vitals stable.

Diagnosis: Obesity, Class I

Plan: Detailed nutrition counseling, referral to dietician, daily exercise goal of 30 minutes, follow up in 1 month.

EHR_37.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Constipation

History of Present Illness: Hard, infrequent stools (once every 3-4 days), associated with abdominal discomfort.

Examination Findings: Soft abdomen, bowel sounds normal, no mass palpable.

Diagnosis: Functional Constipation

Plan: Increase fiber and fluid intake, start Polyethylene Glycol (MiraLAX) daily, monitor stools.

EHR_38.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Post-Surgical Follow-up

History of Present Illness: Status post appendectomy 1 week ago, reports mild incisional pain.

Examination Findings: Incision site clean, dry, and intact (CDI), mild tenderness to palpation adjacent to incision.

Diagnosis: Post-procedural pain

Plan: Continue pain medication PRN (Ibuprofen), monitor for signs of infection (fever, discharge), follow up in 2 weeks.

EHR_39.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Hyperlipidemia

History of Present Illness: Initial lab work showed elevated total cholesterol and LDL.

Examination Findings: Vitals stable, cardiovascular exam normal, BMI 26.

Diagnosis: Pure Hypercholesterolemia

Plan: Begin statin therapy (Atorvastatin 10mg), low-cholesterol diet counseling, repeat lipid panel in 3 months.

EHR_40.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Peripheral Neuropathy

History of Present Illness: Numbness and tingling in both feet, gradually worsening, history of long-standing diabetes.

Examination Findings: Decreased vibratory sensation and monofilament test failure in bilateral feet.

Diagnosis: Diabetic Polyneuropathy

Plan: Optimize blood glucose control (HbA1c goal <7.0), prescribe Gabapentin for nerve pain, podiatry referral.

EHR_41.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Minor Burn

History of Present Illness: Touched a hot curling iron on the forearm 1 hour ago, blister formed.

Examination Findings: 1cm partial thickness burn (second degree) on the right forearm, intact blister, no signs of infection.

Diagnosis: Second degree burn, forearm

Plan: Apply silver sulfadiazine cream, sterile dressing change daily, pain control with NSAIDs, return if blister breaks or signs of infection appear.

EHR_42.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Sinusitis

History of Present Illness: 10 days of nasal congestion, facial pain, post-nasal drip, and mild fever.

Examination Findings: Maxillary and frontal sinus tenderness, mucopurulent discharge present.

Diagnosis: Acute Bacterial Sinusitis

Plan: Prescribe Amoxicillin/Clavulanate for 7 days, nasal saline rinse, decongestant PRN.

EHR_43.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Chronic Joint Pain

History of Present Illness: Generalized achiness in multiple large joints (shoulders, hands), morning stiffness lasting over an hour.

Examination Findings: Symmetrical swelling and tenderness of MCP and PIP joints, rheumatoid factor ordered.

Diagnosis: Rheumatoid Arthritis, suspected

Plan: Start Methotrexate pending lab results, rheumatology referral, anti-inflammatory medication (Celecoxib).

EHR_44.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Varicella Exposure

History of Present Illness: Exposed to a sibling with chickenpox 3 days ago, patient is unvaccinated.

Examination Findings: Asymptomatic today, skin clear.

Diagnosis: Exposure to Varicella

Plan: Isolate patient from school/daycare for 21 days, monitor for rash/fever, counsel parents on signs and symptoms.

EHR_45.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Cataract Evaluation

History of Present Illness: Gradual blurring of vision over the past year, especially difficulty driving at night.

Examination Findings: Slit-lamp exam reveals opacification of the lens bilaterally.

Diagnosis: Age-related Cataract, bilateral

Plan: Referral to ophthalmology for surgical consultation (phacoemulsification), counsel on low-light safety.

EHR_46.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Anxiety

History of Present Illness: Frequent panic attacks, excessive worry, avoidance of social situations for 8 months.

Examination Findings: Tremulous, tearful during interview, heart rate elevated, otherwise normal exam.

Diagnosis: Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD)

Plan: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT) referral, start Sertraline low dose, schedule weekly check-ins.

EHR_47.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Vomiting

History of Present Illness: Several episodes of non-bloody, non-bilious vomiting over the last 6 hours, denies diarrhea.

Examination Findings: Mild tachycardia, dry mucous membranes, irritable, mild abdominal distension.

Diagnosis: Dehydration due to Acute Vomiting

Plan: Oral rehydration solution (ORS) every 5 minutes, monitor urine output, anti-emetic medication (Ondansetron) if needed.

EHR_48.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Thyroid Nodule

History of Present Illness: Found a small lump in the neck during self-exam. Asymptomatic.

Examination Findings: Palpable firm, non-tender nodule in the right lobe of the thyroid.

Diagnosis: Thyroid Nodule, size 1cm

Plan: Order thyroid function tests (TSH) and ultrasound of the thyroid, referral to Endocrinology for Fine-Needle Aspiration (FNA).

EHR_49.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Erectile Dysfunction

History of Present Illness: Difficulty achieving and maintaining erection sufficient for intercourse for 3 months. Denies psychological stress.

Examination Findings: Genital exam normal, vitals stable, initial lab work (Testosterone, lipids) pending.

Diagnosis: Male Erectile Dysfunction

Plan: Prescribe a PDE-5 inhibitor (Sildenafil) PRN, counsel on lifestyle factors (smoking, alcohol).

EHR_50.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Osteoporosis Screening

History of Present Illness: Post-menopausal female, seeking baseline screening, no prior fractures.

Examination Findings: Exam normal, vitals stable, review of risk factors positive (low calcium intake).

Diagnosis: Encounter for osteoporosis screening

Plan: Order DEXA scan, counsel on Calcium and Vitamin D supplementation, discuss bisphosphonate therapy if DEXA positive.

EHR_51.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Concussion

History of Present Illness: Hit head playing soccer, brief loss of consciousness, headache, confusion, and nausea since injury.

Examination Findings: Positive Romberg test, slightly slurred speech, GCS 15.

Diagnosis: Concussion with loss of consciousness

Plan: Strict cognitive and physical rest, monitor for worsening symptoms (severe vomiting, seizures), written discharge instructions provided.

EHR_52.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Recurrent Yeast Infection

History of Present Illness: Three episodes of vaginal itching and thick discharge in the past year, resistant to OTC treatments.

Examination Findings: Thick, curdy white discharge, vulvar erythema, pH normal.

Diagnosis: Recurrent Vulvovaginal Candidiasis

Plan: Prescribe Fluconazole 150mg STAT and repeat in 3 days, counsel on underlying risk factors (diabetes screening ordered).

EHR_53.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Gout Flare

History of Present Illness: Sudden, excruciating pain and swelling in the right great toe overnight. Denies trauma.

Examination Findings: Right MTP joint is hot, red, and exquisitely tender, unable to bear weight.

Diagnosis: Acute Gouty Arthritis

Plan: Colchicine for acute attack, NSAIDs, start Allopurinol after flare resolves, strict diet modification (avoid purines).

EHR_54.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Elevated Cholesterol Follow-up

History of Present Illness: Non-compliant with prescribed statin due to muscle aches, seeking alternative.

Examination Findings: Vitals stable, muscular exam unremarkable.

Diagnosis: Hypercholesterolemia, non-compliant due to side effects

Plan: Switch medication to Ezetimibe, counsel on diet and exercise, recheck lipid panel in 8 weeks.

EHR_55.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Dental Pain

History of Present Illness: Severe pain in the lower right molar that is constant and throbbing, radiating to the jaw.

Examination Findings: Visible deep carious lesion on the mandibular right first molar, percussion tenderness.

Diagnosis: Dental Caries with Pulpitis

Plan: Amoxicillin for cellulitis prophylaxis, referral to Endodontist for root canal evaluation.

EHR_56.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Chronic Headaches

History of Present Illness: Tension-type headaches 4-5 times per week, bilateral, dull pressure, exacerbated by stress.

Examination Findings: No focal neurological deficits, mild tenderness of trapezius muscles.

Diagnosis: Chronic Tension-type Headache

Plan: Stress management techniques, referral for massage therapy, trial of muscle relaxant (Cyclobenzaprine).

EHR_57.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Eczema Flare

History of Present Illness: Areas of scaly, dry, intensely itchy skin on the inner elbows and behind the knees, ongoing.

Examination Findings: Lichenification and patchy erythema in flexural creases, chronic appearance.

Diagnosis: Atopic Dermatitis, chronic

Plan: Emollients daily, medium-potency topical steroid cream for flares, avoidance of long hot showers.

EHR_58.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Sprained Finger

History of Present Illness: Jammed finger catching a ball at recess, pain and swelling in the middle finger.

Examination Findings: Swelling and tenderness over the PIP joint of the left middle finger, good distal neurovascular function.

Diagnosis: Sprain of the PIP joint, middle finger

Plan: Buddy taping to adjacent finger, ice, elevation, NSAIDs for pain, follow up if swelling does not resolve in 7 days.

EHR_59.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Annual Flu Vaccine

History of Present Illness: Seeking routine seasonal influenza vaccination, no contraindications.

Examination Findings: Vitals stable, no acute findings.

Diagnosis: Encounter for routine influenza vaccination

Plan: Administer quadrivalent inactivated influenza vaccine (IIV4), observe for 15 minutes post-injection.

EHR_60.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Dizziness

History of Present Illness: Feeling lightheaded upon standing quickly from sitting, especially in the mornings.

Examination Findings: Orthostatic blood pressure check shows a 25mmHg drop in systolic pressure.

Diagnosis: Orthostatic Hypotension

Plan: Increase fluid and salt intake (if not hypertensive), counsel on slow positional changes, review medication list for offending agents.

EHR_61.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Smoking Cessation

History of Present Illness: Patient reports readiness to quit smoking, currently smoking 1 pack per day for 15 years.

Examination Findings: Lung auscultation reveals mild expiratory wheezes.

Diagnosis: Tobacco Use Disorder

Plan: Prescribe nicotine replacement therapy (patch/gum), referral to quit line, schedule follow up in 1 week.

EHR_62.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Immunization Visit

History of Present Illness: Due for 4-year well-child visit immunizations (DTaP, IPV, MMR, Varicella).

Examination Findings: Exam normal, patient healthy.

Diagnosis: Routine DTaP/IPV/MMR/Varicella immunization

Plan: Administer required vaccinations, provide vaccine record to parent, schedule next check-up in 1 year.

EHR_63.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Chronic Cough

History of Present Illness: Persistent dry cough for 3 months, worse at night and after meals, denies sputum.

Examination Findings: Pulmonary exam clear, CXR is normal.

Diagnosis: Cough due to Post-nasal Drip

Plan: Trial of a first-generation antihistamine/decongestant, nasal saline irrigation, re-evaluate in 2 weeks.

EHR_64.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Contraception

History of Present Illness: Seeking highly effective, long-acting reversible contraception (LARC).

Examination Findings: Pelvic exam deferred, breast exam normal.

Diagnosis: Encounter for contraceptive management

Plan: Discuss options (IUD vs. Implant), schedule insertion appointment for Mirena IUD next month.

EHR_65.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Fatigue (Cancer Follow-up)

History of Present Illness: Status post chemotherapy for colon cancer 6 months ago, reports mild lingering fatigue.

Examination Findings: Vitals stable, no lymphadenopathy, abdomen soft, no masses.

Diagnosis: Personal history of malignant neoplasm of colon

Plan: Order comprehensive blood work (CBC, metabolic panel), continue surveillance schedule, advise light exercise.

EHR_66.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Ingrown Toenail

History of Present Illness: Pain and redness on the lateral aspect of the right great toe, started 3 days ago.

Examination Findings: Erythema, swelling, and purulent drainage present at the lateral border of the right hallux.

Diagnosis: Ingrown toenail with infection

Plan: Digital block and partial nail plate excision performed, oral antibiotic (Keflex) for 7 days, warm soaks.

EHR_67.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Sprained Wrist

History of Present Illness: Fell onto outstretched hand 4 hours ago, severe pain and swelling over the wrist.

Examination Findings: Diffuse swelling over the wrist, tenderness over the distal radius, X-ray ordered.

Diagnosis: Sprain of the wrist

Plan: Wrist splint application, R.I.C.E. protocol, pain management with NSAIDs, follow up with imaging results.

EHR_68.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Hemorrhoids

History of Present Illness: Painful external hemorrhoid, mild bleeding with bowel movements for 1 week.

Examination Findings: External thrombosed hemorrhoid noted at the 7 o'clock position.

Diagnosis: Thrombosed external hemorrhoids

Plan: Topical hydrocortisone cream, sitz baths 3 times daily, stool softeners, high-fiber diet.

EHR_69.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Contusion (Bruise)

History of Present Illness: Hit leg on a table corner yesterday, large bruise present, no functional impairment.

Examination Findings: Large ecchymosis on the anterior left thigh, no underlying mass or crepitus.

Diagnosis: Contusion of left thigh

Plan: Ice PRN for 24 hours, monitor for any worsening pain or restricted movement, reassurance.

EHR_70.clinical_note:
Chief Complaint: Chronic Kidney Disease Follow-up

History of Present Illness: Stage 3 CKD, compliant with diet and medications, reports no new symptoms.

Examination Findings: BP 130/80mmHg, no peripheral edema.

Diagnosis: Chronic Kidney Disease, Stage 3

Plan: Continue low-salt, low-protein diet, review blood pressure targets, recheck kidney function labs in 3 months.
